item.title: Generative AI is finding fertile soil in the healthcare industry

item.title: Small Businesses Are Slower to Adopt AI. Here’s Why
item.description: A new NFIB survey shows that typically innovative and responsive entrepreneurs lag behind bigger companies in using AI to improve their operations.

item.title: On Apple’s 20th Anniversary of Podcasting, the Company Is Celebrating With Its 20 Favorite Shows
item.description: Apple’s ’20 Years, 20 Podcasts We Love,’ celebrates an industry it helped nurture.

item.title: Republicans are scrambling after learning their proposed cuts to Medicaid, which would offset trillions in tax breaks, violate Senate rules
item.description: It's a major blow to Trump's "big, beautiful" spending bill.

item.title: Fortnite players can cash in on another $126 million in refunds after being ‘tricked’ into unwanted purchases—here’s how
item.description: The refunds are part of a $520 million settlement that Epic agreed to pay back in 2022.

item.title: To Fall Asleep Faster, Science Says Just Do This for 5 Minutes
item.description: Worried about tomorrow? Pen and paper is all you need to fall asleep faster, and stay asleep.

item.title: Why this former OpenAI researcher thinks it’s time to start gaming out AI’s future
item.description: Former OpenAI safety researcher Steven Adler explains why simulating AI’s rise could help us prepare.

item.title: Conservatives and environmentalists say carbon capture is unnecessarily expensive and fails to curb pollution effectively. Here’s what the science says
item.description: Carbon capture and sequestration is seen by many as an important way to reduce pollution during a transition to renewable energy.

item.title: Overrun With Disruptions? Here’s How to Stay Focused on What Matters While Running a Business
item.description: Disruptions can immediately throw your plans off track. Stick to your schedule with these tips.
